za.sabob.olive
Class Olive

java.lang.Object
  za.sabob.olive.Olive

public class Olive
extends Object

Provides the main entry point for using Olive.

Load SQL files

Olive provides the method loadSql(java.lang.String) for loading and caching external SQL files. For example: 
 Olive olive = new Olive(Mode.DEVELOPMENT);
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(PersonDao.class, "select-person.sql");
 String sql = olive.loadSql(filename);

Mode

By default Olive is in Mode.PRODUCTION mode and loaded SQL files are cached for fast retrieval in the future.

If Olive is created in Mode.DEVELOPMENT mode, the loaded sql files are not cached and will be reloaded when changed.

Mode.TRACE mode provides fine grained logging which is useful when tracing errors such as missing named parameters. 

 // By default Olive is in PRODUCTION mode.
 Olive olive = new Olive();

 // Start Olive in DEVELOPMENT mode
 olive = new Olive(Mode.DEVELOPMENT);

 // Start olive in TRACE mode
 olive = new Olive(Mode.TRACE);

Named parameters

Use loadParsedSql(java.lang.String) to load SQL files and then parse the result to locate named parameters. This method returns a ParsedSql instance which contains information about the named parameters such as their names and location. 
 Olive olive = new Olive();
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(PersonDao.class, "select-person.sql");
 ParsedSql parsedSql = olive.loadParsedSql(filename);
 List<int[]> namedParameterIndexes = parsedSql.getParameterIndexes();
 int totalParameterCount = parsedSql.getTotalParameterCount();
 String originalSql = parsedSql.getOriginalSql();
In production mode the ParsedSql is cached so future requests do not have to reparse the SQL string.

PreparedStatements

Olive provides the prepareStatement(java.sql.Connection, za.sabob.olive.ps.ParsedSql, za.sabob.olive.ps.SqlParams) and prepareStatement(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String, za.sabob.olive.ps.SqlParams) methods for creating PreparedStatements which uses convenient named parameters instead of indexes.

select-person.sql: 

 SELECT * FROM person p WHERE p.name = :name and p.age = :age

Example.java: 

 Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:...", "username", "password");
 Olive olive = new Olive(Mode.DEVELOPMENT);
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(Persondao.class, "select-person.sql");
 SqlParams params = new SqlParams();
 * params.setString("name", "Bob");
 params.setInt("age", 21);
 PreparedStatement ps = olive.prepareStatement(conn, filename, params);

loadSql

public String loadSql(String filename)
Loads the SQL file for the given filename. 
 Olive olive = new Olive();
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(PersonDao.class, "select-person.sql");
 String sql = olive.loadSql(filename);

Parameters:
filename - the name of the SQL file to load
Returns:
the content of the SQL filename as a string
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the SQL file could not be found

loadParsedSql

public ParsedSql loadParsedSql(String filename)
Loads and parse the SQL file for the given filename. 
 Olive olive = new Olive();
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(PersonDao.class, "select-person.sql");
 ParsedSql parsedSql = olive.loadParsedSql(filename);
 List<int[]> namedParameterIndexes = parsedSql.getParameterIndexes();
 int totalParameterCount = parsedSql.getTotalParameterCount();
 String originalSql = parsedSql.getOriginalSql();

Parameters:
filename - the name of the SQL file to load and parse
Returns:
the content of the SQL filename as a ParsedSql instance

prepareStatement

public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(Connection conn,
                                          ParsedSql parsedSql,
                                          SqlParams params)
Creates a PreparedStatement for the given arguments. The named parameters specified in the ParsedSql will be substituted with given SqlParams. For example: select-person.sql: 
 SELECT * FROM person p WHERE p.name = :name and p.age = :age

Example.java: 

 Olive olive = new Olive();
 Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:...", "username", "password");
 Olive olive = new Olive(Mode.DEVELOPMENT);
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(Persondao.class, "select-person.sql");
 ParsedSql parsedSql = olive.loadParsedSql(filename);
 SqlParams params = new SqlParams();
 * params.setString("name", "Bob");
 params.setInt("age", 21);
 PreparedStatement ps = olive.prepareStatement(conn, parsedSql, params);

Parameters:
conn - the connection for creating the PreparedStatement with
parsedSql - the ParsedSql for creating the PreparedStatement with
params - the params for creating the PreparedStatement with
Returns:
the PreparedStatement for the given arguments

prepareStatement

public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(Connection conn,
                                          String filename,
                                          SqlParams params)
Creates a PreparedStatement for the given arguments. The named parameters in SQL file specified through the filename will be substituted with given SqlParams. For example: select-person.sql: 
 SELECT * FROM person p WHERE p.name = :name and p.age = :age

Example.java: 

 Olive olive = new Olive();
 Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:...", "username", "password");
 Olive olive = new Olive(Mode.DEVELOPMENT);
 String filename = OliveUtils.normalize(Persondao.class, "select-person.sql");
 SqlParams params = new SqlParams();
 * params.setString("name", "Bob");
 params.setInt("age", 21);
 PreparedStatement ps = olive.prepareStatement(conn, filename, params);

Parameters:
conn - the connection for creating the PreparedStatement with
filename - the name of the SQL file to load and use for creating the PreparedStatement with
params - the params for creating the PreparedStatement with
Returns:
the PreparedStatement for the given arguments
